Class HDBManager

java.lang.Object
User
HDBManager
public class HDBManager extends User
Provides functions for HDB Managers to perfrom operations.

    • createProject

      public ArrayList<Project> createProject(String projectDetails, ArrayList<HDBManager> hdbManager, ArrayList<HDBOfficer> hdbOfficer)
      Creates a new project and subsequently updates the txt file that stores all project details
      Parameters:

      hdbManager - Array list of managers, used to assign manager with the project
      hdbOfficer - Array list of officiers, used to assign officers with the project
      Returns:
      array list of all current existing projects

    • editProject

      public boolean editProject(String projectName, String updateContent, String target, ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, int i)
      Edits various attributes of a housing project and updates both the data file and in-memory objects.

      This method handles different types of project modifications based on the target parameter, including project name, neighborhood, flat pricing, unit counts, and application dates. Changes are written to the project data file and reflected in the corresponding Project objects.

      Parameters:
      projectName - The current name of the project to be edited
      updateContent - The new value(s) for the attribute being updated (format depends on target)
      target - The type of edit to perform (see details below)
      currentProjects - List of all current projects
      i - Index of the project to edit in currentProjects list
      Returns:
      true if the edit was successful, false if there are no managed projects
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if numeric conversion fails for pricing or unit updates
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the project index is invalid Target Options:
      • "0" - Update Project Name (updateContent = new project name)
      • "1" - Update Neighborhood (updateContent = new neighborhood name)
      • "2" - Update Flat Pricing (updateContent = "flatType,newPrice")
      • "3" - Update Unit Count (updateContent = "flatType,newUnitCount")
      • "4" - Change Application Opening Date (updateContent = new date as "d/M/yyyy")
      • "5" - Change Application Closing Date (updateContent = new date as "d/M/yyyy")

      File Operations: The method updates the project data in "ProjectList.txt" in the directory ./Data

      See Also:
      • General.editFile(String, String, String, String)
      • Project
      • FlatType

    • deletProject

      public Project deletProject(Project targetProject)
      Deletes a project object storage and runtime. This method performs two main operations:
      1. Removes the project from the ProjectList.txt data file under ./Data
      2. Removes the project from the managedProjects list
      Parameters:
      targetProject - The project to be deleted (must not be null)
      Returns:
      The deleted project if no projects are managed or if an error occurs, null if deletion was successful
      See Also:
      • Project
      • FileWriter
      • Scanner

    • returnProject

      public Project returnProject(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String projectName)
      Searches for and returns a specific project by its unique name from a list of projects.

      This method performs a linear search through the provided list of projects to find a project with a matching name (case-sensitive comparison). The project name serves as a unique identifier for this lookup operation.

      Parameters:
      currentProjects - The list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      projectName - The name of the project to find (case-sensitive, must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      The found Project object if exists, null if no matching project is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either currentProjects or projectName is null
      See Also:
      • Project.getProjectName()

    • currentActiveProject

      public Project currentActiveProject(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String userName, boolean printCheck)
      Finds and returns the currently active project for the specified manager from a list of projects. An active project is defined as one where:
      • Under specific HDB manager's managed projects
      • The current date is within the project's application period
      • The project is visible
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      userName - the name of the HDB manager to match (must not be null or empty)
      printCheck - flag to control whether to print status messages: - If true, prints active project details when found or "No Active Project" message when none found - If false, operates silently
      Returns:
      the currently active project if found, null otherwise
      See Also:
      • Project

    • isWithinApplicationPeriod

      public boolean isWithinApplicationPeriod(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String projectName)
      Checks whether the specified project is within its application period.

      The method searches for a project with the given name in the provided project list and verifies if the current system time falls between the project's application opening and closing dates.

      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null or contain null elements)
      projectName - the name of the project to check (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      true if:
      • The project exists in the list
      • The current time is within application period
      false if:
      • The project is not found in the list
      • The current time is not within the application period
      See Also:
      • Project.getProjectName()
      • Project.getApplicationOpeningDate()
      • Project.getApplicationClosingDate()

    • listRequiredProjects

      public void listRequiredProjects(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, int i)
      Prints detailed information about a specific project from the list of projects. This method displays a formatted output containing all relevant project details
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      i - the index of the project to display in the currentProjects list (must be a valid index)
      See Also:
      • Project
      • The output format: 
         Project Name: [name] | Neighborhood: [neighborhood] | Visibility: [visibility]
    - Flat Details:
       - Flat Type: [type], Units: [units], Price: $[price]
       - [additional flat types...]
    - Application Period: [start date] to [end date]
    - HDB Manager: [manager name]
    - Available HDB Officer Slots: [number]
    - HDB Officer In-Charge: [officer1] [officer2]... or "Not set"

    • listAllExistingProjects

      public void listAllExistingProjects(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects)
      Prints list of all existing projects with their details.
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to display (must not be null, but can be empty)
      See Also:
      • The output format is as follows: 
         === List of All Existing Projects ===
 
 [Project 1 details - same format as listRequiredProjects]
 [Project 2 details]
 ...
 
 Total Projects: [count]
 ===============================
        Example output: 
         === List of All Existing Projects ===
 
 Project Name: Sunshine Residences | Neighborhood: Tampines | Visibility: true
    - Flat Details:
       - Flat Type: 3-Room, Units: 150, Price: $300000.00
       - Flat Type: 4-Room, Units: 100, Price: $400000.00
    - Application Period: Mon Jan 01 00:00:00 SGT 2024 to Fri Jan 12 23:59:59 SGT 2024
    - HDB Manager: John Tan
    - Available HDB Officer Slots: 2
    - HDB Officer In-Charge: Sarah Lim Michael Wong
 
 Total Projects: 1
 ===============================

    • listSpecificProjects

      public void listSpecificProjects(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String username)
      Prints list of projects managed by a specific HDB manager.

      This method displays all projects where the specified user is the assigned HDB manager, including complete project details and a total count of matching projects.

      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to filter through (must not be null, but can be empty)
      username - the name of the HDB manager to filter by (case-sensitive, must not be null or empty)
      See Also:
      • The output includes: 
         === List of All Your Existing Projects ===
 
 [Project details for manager's projects - same format as listRequiredProjects]
 ...
 
 Total Projects: [count]
 ===============================

    • toggleVisibility

      public void toggleVisibility(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String projectName)
      Toggles the visibility status of a specified project and updates both the runtime list and storage.

      This method performs the following operations:

      1. Locates the project by name in the provided list
      2. Inverts the current visibility status (ON to OFF or OFF to ON)
      3. Updates the project's visibility in the ProjectList.txt file
      4. Updates the runtime Project object
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      projectName - the exact name of the project to modify (case-sensitive, must not be null or empty)
      See Also:
      • General
      • Project

    • viewOfficerRegistrationList

      public void viewOfficerRegistrationList()
      Displays the officer registration list. The method expects the file to have the following format per line: 
       officerName,officerNRIC,projectName,registrationStatus
      Example output: 
       1. John Tan|S1234567A|Sunshine Residences|Approved
 2. Sarah Lim|T9876543B|Riverfront Residences|Pending
      The default file path is "./src/Data/OfficerRegistrationList.txt" (Note: Developers should ensure this path is correct for their environment)

    • approveOrRejectOfficerRegistration

      public void approveOrRejectOfficerRegistration(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, ArrayList<Applicant> applicants, ArrayList<HDBOfficer> HDBOfficers, String userName)
      Processes pending officer registrations by approving or rejecting them based on various validation checks.

      This method performs the following operations for each pending registration: When function called, we will run through officerRegistration list, first for loop will be size of officer list Will check if status is pending If no, go next officer If yes, get officer NRIC and projectName Check if manager is managing project Check if request is pending Check if officer is in applicants /If yes need reject Check if officer is handling another project within date Check if officer is handling another project in projectlist If no, approve If yes, get project endDate check currentProject's startDate or get project startDate and currentProject's endDate Check if startDate of registeredProject is before endDate of alreadyRegisteredProject Check if startDate or endDate of RegisteringProject is in between startDate and endDate of alreadyRegisteredProject Check if there is slot for the project

      Parameters:
      currentProjects - List of all current projects (must not be null)
      applicants - List of all applicants (must not be null)
      HDBOfficers - List of all HDB officers (must not be null)
      userName - Name of the manager processing the requests (must not be null or empty)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any required parameter is null
      IllegalArgumentException - If userName is empty The method enforces these business rules:
      1. Automatic rejection if officer is in applicant list
      2. Date conflict check with other assigned projects
      3. Slot availability verification
      4. Manager authorization check
      FileOperations
      • Reads from ./src/Data/OfficerRegistrationList.txt
      • Writes to DataFilePath + "/ProjectList.txt"
      • Updates registration status in OfficerRegistrationList.txt
      ExampleOutput 
       Officer John Doe has been rejected from Project Sunshine as he/she is in applicants list
 Officer Jane Smith has been approved for Project Riverfront

    • approveOrRejectApplication

      public void approveOrRejectApplication(Applicant applicant, Project project)
      To approve or reject application to certain project
      Parameters:
      applicant - Application to be approved or rejected
      project - Target project

    • rejectApplication

      public void rejectApplication(Applicant applicant, Project project)
      Reject an application
      Parameters:
      applicant - targeted application
      project - allocated project

    • approveWithdrawal

      public void approveWithdrawal(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, ArrayList<Applicant> applicants)
      Processes all pending withdrawal requests from applicants.

      This method performs the following operations for each applicant with a pending withdrawal:

      1. Changes application status from PENDINGWITHDRAWAL to WITHDRAWN
      2. Removes the application from the project's application list
      3. Clears the application reference from the applicant
      4. If a flat was booked, increases available units for that flat type
      5. Prints confirmation of each processed withdrawal
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - List of all current projects (must not be null, used to verify project references)
      applicants - List of all applicants to process (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either parameter is null Eample output 
       Withdrawn application for applicant John Tan (NRIC: S1234567A)
 Withdrawn application for applicant Sarah Lim (NRIC: T9876543B)
      See Also:
      • ApplicationStatus
      • FlatTypeLogic.updateIncreaseFilteredFlatTypeUnits(ArrayList, FlatType)

    • generateApplicantReport

      public void generateApplicantReport(ArrayList<Applicant> applicants, String maritalStatusFilter, Integer minAge, Integer maxAge)
      Generates and prints a filtered report of applicants with their application details.

      The report includes applicants matching all specified filter criteria (marital status and age range), showing their name, applied project, flat type, age, and marital status.

      Parameters:
      applicants - List of applicants to generate report from (must not be null)
      maritalStatusFilter - Marital status to filter by (case-insensitive, null to skip this filter)
      minAge - Minimum age for filtering (inclusive, null for no minimum)
      maxAge - Maximum age for filtering (inclusive, null for no maximum)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if applicants parameter is null The report follows this format:

      === Applicant report === Name | Project | Flat Type | Age | Marital Status [Applicant 1 details] [Applicant 2 details] ...

    • replyToEnquiry

      public void replyToEnquiry(Enquiry enquiry, String reply)
      Method used to add reply to the enquiry by the manager
      Parameters:
      enquiry - the enquiry to be replied
      reply - the reply message to the enquiry
